metadata.title: CVE-2013-7397 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Async Http Client (aka AHC or async-http-client) before 1.9.0 skips X.509certificate verification unless both a keyStore location and a trustStorelocation are explicitly set, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers tospoof HTTPS servers by presenting an arbitrary certificate during use of atypical AHC configuration, as demonstrated by a configuration that does notsend client certificates.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7397` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libasync-http-client-java - 1.6.5-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: async-http-client package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-2ubuntu0.1~esm1').
